fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article on the EU elections was headlined “Fifth of EU27 nationals in the UK were unable to vote” (5 June, page 16). That should have said a fifth were able to vote, as stated in the article, and, in fact, in some areas as few as 10% of EU27 nationals were able to vote. • Homophone corner: “The last three years have seen Britain’s establishment … do their damnedest to delay, diffuse and dilute Brexit” (The energy behind Farage leaves his rivals in the shadows, 25 May, page 4, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Crispr gene-editing will change the way Americans eat – here’s what’s coming Poem of the month: Something Like Dying, Maybe Gareth Batty’s guide to the Cricket World Cup grounds
